{"step_by_step_thinking": "Levonorgestrel is a hormone used in many birth control methods. In addition to contraception, it has several other uses. It can be used to treat endometriosis, a condition where tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside of the uterus. It can also be used to manage premenstrual tension, a group of symptoms that occur in women before their menstrual period. Complex endometrial hyperplasia, a condition characterized by the excessive proliferation of the cells of the endometrium, can also be managed with levonorgestrel. However, emergency contraception is a contraceptive use of levonorgestrel, not a non-contraceptive use.", "answer_choice": "D"}
